cybercrime_reporting_guide.introduction: This guide provides the official steps for reporting cybercrime in India. The two primary methods are the National Cyber Crime Helpline (1930) for immediate financial fraud and the National Cyber Crime Reporting Portal (www.cybercrime.gov.in) for all types of cybercrime.

financial_fraud_reporting.title: Immediate Action for Financial Fraud: Call 1930
financial_fraud_reporting.description: If you have lost money through any online financial fraud (e.g., UPI scam, phishing, credit/debit card fraud), your first and most critical step is to call the National Cyber Crime Helpline Number: 1930

details.purpose: This helpline is part of the Citizen Financial Cyber Fraud Reporting and Management System
details.benefit: Reporting immediately increases the chance of blocking the fraudulent transaction and recovering your money

national_portal.title: Primary Method for All Cybercrimes: The National Portal
national_portal.scope: This portal is used for reporting all cybercrimes, including financial fraud, social media harassment, cyberstalking, data theft, ransomware, etc.

filing_steps.title: Steps to File a Complaint on www.cybercrime.gov.in
steps: Visit the Portal: Go to www.cybercrime.gov.in
Start Complaint: Click the "File a Complaint" button on the homepage
Accept Terms: Read and accept the terms and conditions
Choose Crime Category: Select the appropriate option
Create User ID: Register on the portal by selecting your state and providing a login ID and mobile number to receive an OTP
Fill Incident Details: Complete the complaint form with accurate information
Upload Evidence: Attach all the digital evidence you have collected

crime_categories.women_child: Report Women/Child Related Crime: Use this for crimes where the victim is a woman or child (e.g., online harassment, cyberstalking, child pornography). This can be reported anonymously
crime_categories.other: Report Other Cybercrime: Use this for all other crimes (e.g., financial fraud, phishing, hacking)

required_details: Category and sub-category of the crime
Date, time, and delay in reporting
The platform where the incident occurred (e.g., Instagram, website, email)
A detailed description of the incident

evidence_collection.title: How to Collect and Preserve Evidence
evidence_collection.introduction: Before filing your complaint, gather as much digital evidence as possible. Do not delete anything related to the incident.

online_harassment: Take clear screenshots of abusive messages, comments, or fake profiles
Ensure the URL of the profile/page is visible or noted down
financial_fraud: Keep a record of the fraudulent transaction ID
Save bank statements showing the debit
Save any SMS or email communication from the scammer
email_scams: Save the original email as a file (.eml or .msg)
Use the "Save As" or "Download original" option in your email client
ransomware: Take a clear photograph of the ransom note displayed on your screen

post_filing_process.title: What Happens After You File a Complaint?

steps.description: Upon submission, you will receive a unique acknowledgment number (reference ID) for your complaint
You can use this number to track the status of your complaint on the portal
The complaint is automatically forwarded to the relevant police authorities (State Cyber Police, District Cyber Cell, etc.) for investigation and further action
